message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.DB, cs.SI, cs.CL 

The paper deals with mining scholarly data to find comparable researchers, which involves analyzing publication records and matching them based on quality of publishing venues and research topics. This suggests that the paper could fall under several sub-categories such as cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.DB (Databases), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.CL (Computation and Language). However, given the focus on publication records and matching, cs.DL and cs.IR seem to be the most likely sub-categories.
